definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: The lesions will "bleach out" and become clean wounds that will heal after a molt.
sentences.chinese: 病变会“漂白了”，成为清洁伤口愈合后，将蜕皮。

sentences.english: Iron corrodes unless it is greased or kept clean.
sentences.chinese: 如果不涂油或保持清洁铁便会腐蚀。

sentences.english: We need to unleash massive private investment in clean energy.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在清洁能源方面发动大量的私人投资。

sentences.english: House of Mountaineers stacks the firewood, neat and clean.
sentences.chinese: 山民房子边堆起的柴薪，整齐而清洁。

sentences.english: Clear the Electronic balance and Weights gauge by alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 用酒精对电子称及砝码进行清洁。

sentences.english: There is no such thing as a self-cleaning oven.
sentences.chinese: 世界上还没有会自动清洁的炉灶。

sentences.english: They should also be constantly concerned in taking care and cleaning their stoma .
sentences.chinese: 他们还应该不断关注，在照顾和清洁他们的气孔。

sentences.english: Besides lacking in hygiene, some lack common sense as well.
sentences.chinese: 有些女生除了没有清洁意识之外，还缺乏基本常识。

sentences.english: A Healthy Liver Cleanses the Body by.
sentences.chinese: 一个健康的肝脏清洁，由团体。

sentences.english: Individual families should be responsible for the cleanliness of their own units.
sentences.chinese: 每个家庭都有义务清洁他们自己的居住单元。

sentences.english: Cleanliness is a foe to disease.
sentences.chinese: 清洁是疾病的敌人，清洁可以祛病。

sentences.english: Cleanliness is a foe to disease.
sentences.chinese: 清洁是疾病的敌人，清洁可以祛病。

sentences.english: Have, if applicable, a smooth non-absorbent ceiling to facilitate cleaning;
sentences.chinese: 天花板应光滑不渗吸水，以便于清洁和卫生。

sentences.english: It's clean and bright inside the dormitory.
He has been the head janitor in our school for ten years.
sentences.chinese: 他在我们学校当了二十年的清洁员工头。

sentences.english: Nearly 400 tons of accumulated refuse and dregs were removed altogether in five days.
sentences.chinese: 五天内清洁工运走了近四百吨堆积的垃圾与渣土。

definition: to clean (with water or alcohol)/to wipe and wash/to swab/to scrub
to clear up/to tidy up/to dispose of
to eliminate dust (i.e. filter out suspended particles)
to dry (of weather, paint, cement etc)/desiccation/dull/uninteresting/arid
